summary: The Department of Defense operates the country's largest employer-sponsored child care program. It provided care to more than 210,000 children of military families in FY 2019. Most of these families use child care centers on bases, but DOD also offers some subsidies to make off-base child care more affordable. We reviewed a 2020 DOD report on its subsidies for off-base providers and efforts to reduce...
title: Military Child Care: Off-Base Financial Assistance and Wait Lists for On-Base Care
